verses.text: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honour in abundance , and joined affinity with Ahab.

And after \add certain\add* years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for him in abundance , and for the people that \add he had\add* with him, and persuaded him to go up \add with him\add* to Ramoth-gilead.\f + \fr 18.2 \ft after…: Heb. at the end of years\f*

And Ahab king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah , Wilt thou go with me to Ramoth-gilead ? And he answered him, I \add am\add* as thou \add art\add*, and my people as thy people ; and \add we will be\add* with thee in the war. \p
¶ And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel , Enquire , I pray thee, at the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to day.

Therefore the king of Israel gathered together of prophets four hundred men , and said unto them, Shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle , or shall I forbear ? And they said , Go up ; for God will deliver \add it\add* into the king’s hand.
But Jehoshaphat said , \add Is there\add* not here a prophet of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* besides, that we might enquire of him?\f + \fr 18.6 \ft besides: Heb. yet, or, more\f*

And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat , \add There is\add* yet one man , by whom we may enquire of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but I hate him; for he never prophesied good unto me, but always evil : the same \add is\add* Micaiah the son of Imla. And Jehoshaphat said , Let not the king say so.
And the king of Israel called for one \add of his\add* officers , and said , Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imla.\f + \fr 18.8 \ft officers: or, eunuchs\f*\f + \fr 18.8 \ft Fetch…: Heb. Hasten\f*

And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah sat either of them on his throne , clothed in \add their\add* robes , and they sat in a void place at the entering in of the gate of Samaria ; and all the prophets prophesied before them.\f + \fr 18.9 \ft void…: or, floor\f*

And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah had made him horns of iron , and said , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, With these thou shalt push Syria until they be consumed.\f + \fr 18.10 \ft they…: Heb. thou consume them\f*
And all the prophets prophesied so, saying , Go up to Ramoth-gilead , and prosper : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall deliver \add it\add* into the hand of the king.

And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake to him, saying , Behold, the words of the prophets \add declare\add* good to the king with one assent ; let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.\f + \fr 18.12 \ft with…: Heb. with one mouth\f*
And Micaiah said , \add As\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth , even what my God saith , that will I speak.

And when he was come to the king , the king said unto him, Micaiah , shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle , or shall I forbear ? And he said , Go ye up , and prosper , and they shall be delivered into your hand.
And the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou say nothing but the truth to me in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*?

Then he said , I did see all Israel scattered upon the mountains , as sheep that have no shepherd : and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , These have no master ; let them return \add therefore\add* every man to his house in peace.
And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat , Did I not tell thee \add that\add* he would not prophesy good unto me, but evil ?\f + \fr 18.17 \ft but evil: or, but for evil\f*

Again he said , Therefore hear the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; I saw the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sitting upon his throne , and all the host of heaven standing on his right hand and \add on\add* his left.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel , that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead ? And one spake saying after this manner , and another saying after that manner.

Then there came out a spirit , and stood before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and said , I will entice him. And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto him, Wherewith?

And he said , I will go out , and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And \add the \+nd Lord\+nd*\add* said , Thou shalt entice \add him\add*, and thou shalt also prevail : go out , and do \add even\add* so.

Now therefore, behold, the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets , and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath spoken evil against thee.
Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near , and smote Micaiah upon the cheek , and said , Which way went the Spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* from me to speak unto thee?
And Micaiah said , Behold, thou shalt see on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.\f + \fr 18.24 \ft into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber\f*
Then the king of Israel said , Take ye Micaiah , and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city , and to Joash the king’s son ;
And say , Thus saith the king , Put this \add fellow\add* in the prison , and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction , until I return in peace.
And Micaiah said , If thou certainly return in peace , \add then\add* hath not the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spoken by me. And he said , Hearken , all ye people. \p
So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat , I will disguise myself, and will go to the battle ; but put thou on thy robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went to the battle.
Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of the chariots that \add were\add* with him, saying , Fight ye not with small or great , save only with the king of Israel.

And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat , that they said , It \add is\add* the king of Israel. Therefore they compassed about him to fight : but Jehoshaphat cried out , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* helped him; and God moved them \add to depart\add* from him.
For it came to pass, that, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel , they turned back again from pursuing him.\f + \fr 18.32 \ft from…: Heb. from after him\f*

And a \add certain\add* man drew a bow at a venture , and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness : therefore he said to his chariot man , Turn thine hand , that thou mayest carry me out of the host ; for I am wounded.\f + \fr 18.33 \ft at a venture: Heb. in his simplicity\f*\f + \fr 18.33 \ft between…: Heb. between the joints and between the breastplate\f*\f + \fr 18.33 \ft wounded: Heb. made sick\f*

And the battle increased that day : howbeit the king of Israel stayed \add himself\add* up in \add his\add* chariot against the Syrians until the even : and about the time of the sun going down he died.
